title: [K-12] Blended Learning-Based Higher Education Instructional Design Evaluation Competency Development Course

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational instructional design principles and online learning tool usage experience
context.additional_context: Focus on acquiring methods to evaluate blended learning design elements (goals, content, activities, resources, assessments) in smartphone-based LMS environments

learning_goals: Learners can analyze three or more lesson examples structured around the five core instructional design elements (objectives, content, activities, resources, assessment) in blended learning environments and submit a report proposing two or more improvements per element.

Using a Likert-scale evaluation tool (5-point scale), learners can measure three or more instructional design components (content organization, activity design, assessment methods) and prepare a report meeting a quality threshold of 4 or higher average per item.
Design and implement mobile-optimized assessment strategies in large-scale learner environments

Through project-based assessment, learners can propose three or more instructional design improvements applicable to elementary/middle/high school science classes (biology, physics, chemistry), achieving an average score of 4 or higher on a 5-point scale in peer reviews and teacher feedback.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
